route: From Ramses (Egypt) → Succoth → Etham → Pi-hahiroth (Red Sea crossing) → Marah (bitter water) → Elim (12 springs) → Wilderness of Sin (manna) → Rephidim (water from rock) → Mount Sinai (law given).
archaeology: Possible Red Sea crossing at Nuweiba Beach (chariot wheels found). Jebel al-Lawz (Saudi Arabia) as Mount Sinai candidate — blackened peak, altar, petroglyphs. Traditional Sinai peninsula site at Jebel Musa.
egypt_context: Pharaoh likely Ramses II (1279-1213 BCE). Store cities Pithom and Raamses excavated. Ipuwer Papyrus parallels plagues (Nile blood, darkness, firstborn death).
